answers.answer: Your TSH suggests hyperthyroidism.  Are you on thyroid medication?  If so, the dosage should probably be decreased  If you have a PCP, I would visit him while you wait for the endo if the internist can not figure this out.

question: I have been treated for hypothyroidism for 32 years.  My levels have remained constant until this past year.  Now my TSH is 0.09 and my T4 is 0.67.  My internist is at a loss with these results.  He is recommending I see an endocrinologist.  I have been trying to get into one all week.  Most do not take new patients.  Or only take patients with Diabetes.  Are these result such that I should pursue this more agressively?  I have lost weight, then gained some back and have been unusually tired to the point I just could not move.  But not tired everyday, just some days.Thanks
title: low t4 and low tsh
